data.title: Actors Who Died in 1947
data.meta_description: Deaths in film & television in 1947. Browse actors, actresses and directors that died in 1947 or search by date or keyword.
data.text:
Eva Tanguay, Canadian-born vaudeville and film singer and entertainer dies at 68

Grace Moore, American soprano and actress (One Night of Love), dies at 48

[Hooper] Sidney Toler, American theater director, playwright, stage and screen actor (Madame X; Meeting at Midnight; Charlie Chan films, 1938-46), dies of cancer at 72

Ben Webster, British actor (Old Curiosity Shop), dies at 82

Sigurd Wallén, Swedish actor and film director (Ebberöds bank, Med folket för fosterlandet), dies at 62

Adrienne Ames [McClure], American actress (Black Sheep; 24 Hours), dies of cancer at 39

Tom O'Brien, American actor (Flying Fool), dies at 56

Henry Kolker, German-American actor and director (Holiday, Baby Face, Mad Love), dies at 72

Richard Le Gallienne, English writer (had affair with Oscar Wilde, father of actress Eva Le Gallienne), dies at 81

Harry Carey [Henry DeWitt Carey II], American actor (Mr. Smith Goes to Washington; Red River), dies at 69

William B. Davidson, American film actor dies at 59

[Joseph Jacinto] Jo Mora, Uruguayan-born American cartoonist, cowboy and illustrator who lived with the Hopi tribe and wrote extensively of his experiences, dies at 70

Dudley Digges, Irish actor (Mutiny on the Bounty, The Invisible Man), dies at 68

Ernst Lubitsch, German actor, producer and film director (To Be or Not to Be, Love Parade, Anna Boleyn, Ninotchka), dies from a heart attack at 55
